DataElement.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Section Two Symptom Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The symptom assessed in Section II of the Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale Section Two Symptom
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.:One of several parts or pieces that fit with others to constitute a whole object; a self-contained part of a larger composition (written or musical)._A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient-rated instrument developed to provide multidimensional information about a diverse group of common symptoms. This 32-question, self-rated questionnaire evaluates the prevalence, characteristics, and distress associated with each of the symptoms.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt sad.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt sad.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt worried.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt worried.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt irritable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual feels or felt nervous.
